page.title: 19INTENSIVE GROWING
page.content: The basin of Offenham which lies low in a bend of the River Avon some three miles outside Evesham has good soil for market gardening. The land is used intensively and a lot of land is now under glass. The land holdings are not large but a produce market in Evesham and a growers' co-operative provide some of the various outlets for the gardeners' produce. The most popular crops under glass appear to be lettuce followed by tomatoes, although the growing of courgettes and peppers is becoming more popular. The outdoor land is used to grow a mixture of crops where radish, lettuce, cabbage and spring onions are common. Recent developments in growing methods has led to an increase in the use of plastic tunnels.
